botan.pubkey.algo.dl_group

Discrete Logarithm Group

License:
Botan is released under the Simplified BSD License (see LICENSE.md)

struct DLGroup;
This class represents discrete logarithm groups. It holds a prime p, a prime q = (p-1)/2 and m_g = x^((p-1)/q) mod p.

const ref const(BigInt) getP();
Get the prime m_p.

Returns:
prime m_p

const ref const(BigInt) getQ();
Get the prime q.

Returns:
prime q

const ref const(BigInt) getG();
Get the base m_g.

Returns:
base m_g

const bool verifyGroup(RandomNumberGenerator rng, bool strong);
Perform validity checks on the group.

Params:
RandomNumberGenerator rng the rng to use
bool strong whether to perform stronger by lengthier tests

Returns:
true if the object is consistent, false otherwise

const string PEM_encode(Format format);
Encode this group into a string using PEM encoding.

Params:
Format format the encoding format

Returns:
string holding the PEM encoded group

const Vector!ubyte DER_encode(Format format);
Encode this group into a string using DER encoding.

Params:
Format format the encoding format

Returns:
string holding the DER encoded group

void BER_decode()(auto ref const Vector!ubyte data, Format format);
Decode a DER/BER encoded group into this instance.

Params:
Vector!ubyte data a vector containing the DER/BER encoded group
Format format the format of the encoded group

void PEM_decode(in string pem);
Decode a PEM encoded group into this instance.

Params:
string pem the PEM encoding of the group

this(in string name);
Construct a DL group that is registered in the configuration.

Params:
string name the name that is configured in the global configuration for the desired group. If no configuration file is specified, the default values from the file policy.cpp will be used. For instance, use "modp/ietf/768" as name.

this(RandomNumberGenerator rng, PrimeType type, size_t pbits, size_t qbits = 0);
Create a new group randomly.

Params:
RandomNumberGenerator rng the random number generator to use
PrimeType type specifies how the creation of primes p and q shall be performed. If , then p will be determined as a safe prime, and q will be chosen as (p-1)/2. If and , then the size of q will be determined according to the estimated difficulty of the DL problem. If type=DSA_Kosherizer, DSA primes will be created.
size_t pbits the number of bits of p
size_t qbits the number of bits of q. Leave it as 0 to have the value determined according to pbits.

this()(RandomNumberGenerator rng, auto ref const Vector!ubyte seed, size_t pbits = 1024, size_t qbits = 0);
Create a DSA group with a given seed.

Params:
RandomNumberGenerator rng the random number generator to use
Vector!ubyte seed the seed to use to create the random primes
size_t pbits the desired bit size of the prime p
size_t qbits the desired bit size of the prime q.

this(ref BigInt p1, ref BigInt g1);
Create a DL group. The prime q will be determined according to p.

Params:
BigInt p1 the prime p
BigInt g1 the base g

this(ref BigInt p1, ref BigInt q1, ref BigInt g1);
Create a DL group.

Params:
BigInt p1 the prime p
BigInt q1 the prime q
BigInt g1 the base g

const @property DLGroup dup();
Duplicate this object

static string getPemForNamedGroup(in string name);
Return PEM representation of named DL group
